intro: Hieracium apicesignatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and is native to Europe, particularly in regions such as Spain and Portugal. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky areas. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium apicesignatum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in disturbed environments.
